sen.j: その理由は、明治政府の雇った鉄道建設担当の英国人技師レイが詐欺まがいの人物で、それまで南アフリカ共和国の鉄道で使われていて、不要になってインドに当時置かれていた中古品（線路・車両）を使って鉄道を安上がりに建設して、私腹を肥やそうとしたからともいわれる。
sen.e: It is said that it happened because British railroad construction engineer Ray employed by the Meiji government was a kind of fraud; he intended to enrich himself by using cheap and unneeded railroad tracks and carriages, which had been used for railway in Republic of South Africa and placed in India at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処レイ；スペル不明
sen.e: The reason is said to be that a fraud-like British railroad construction engineer, Ray, who had been employed by the Meiji government, schemed to line his own pockets by reducing costs by using used and unneeded materials (tracks and carriages) stored in India then, which had been in the Republic of South Africa before.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、分かりやすくするため表現を変えました。
sen.e: The reason for this is said to be that a British railroad construction engineer called Ray who had been employed by the Meiji government engaged in fraudulent practices, scheming to line his own pockets by reducing costs through the use of used and unnecessary equipment (tracks and carriages); this equipment were being stored in India at that time, but had been used in the Republic of South Africa prior to that.

sen.j: 後にレイは解雇されるが、インドから運ばれた資材は予定通りそのまま使用された。
sen.e: Although the Ray was discharged after that, the materials transported from India were used as planned.
Although the Ray was discharged after that, the materials transported from India were used as planned.
Although the Ray was discharged after that, the materials transported from India were used as planned.

sen.j: なお南アフリカの鉄道が狭軌であったのは、同地が山岳地帯であり、産出されるダイヤモンドや金を輸送する鉄道の建設を迅速に進めるには、軌間の狭いほうが速く建設できるためであったという。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is said that narrow gage was used for the railway in South Africa to quickly construct railway, which conveys diamond and gold produced there, because it was faster to built narrow gage in mountainous region.

It is said that the reason why narrow gauge was chosen in the Republic of South Africa was that the railways with narrow gauge was faster to build: they wanted to construct the railways quickly to convey diamond and gold produced in its mountainous land.
sen.cmt: Furthermoreは文の流れに合わないので削除しました。分かりやすくするために表現を変えました。
sen.e: It is said that a narrow gauge was used for railways in the Republic of South Africa because such railways are faster to build, and they wanted to construct railways quickly to transport diamonds and gold mined in mountainous areas of the country.

sen.j: また、当時新政府の財政も担当していた大隈重信が軌間というものを理解していなかったらしい。
sen.e: Moreover, Shigenobu OKUMA who was also in charge of the finances of new government at that time might not understand what the gage of track was.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, reportedly Shigenobu OKUMA, who was also in charge of finance of the new government at that time, did not understand what rail gauge was.
sen.cmt: 文脈に合うよう語と表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: Moreover, reportedly Shigenobu OKUMA, who was also in charge of finance of the new government at that time, did not understand what rail gauge was.

sen.j: エドモンド・モレルなどお雇い外国人が予算や輸送需要を考えれば、狭軌を採用して鉄道を早期に建設すべきと主張して、それら外国人の説得に押されてしまったことに拠るという説もある。
sen.e: Employed foreigners, such as Edmund Morel, might insist to adopt narrow gage in order to construct railway quickly considering the budget and transportation demand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Some say that employed foreigners such as Edmund Morel insisted to adopt narrow gauge in order to construct the railway quickly in consideration of the budget and transportation demand and that he was persuaded by them.
sen.cmt: 本文と次の文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: Some say that employed foreigners such as Edmund Morel insisted to adopt narrow gauge in order to construct the railway quickly in consideration of the budget and transportation demand and that he was persuaded by them.

sen.j: もっともこの場合でも、当時の日本政府の財政事情（西郷隆盛も反対論の理由の一つに財政問題を挙げている）から、ヨーロッパやアメリカ合衆国の本線用の車両を購入して輸送するコストを考えれば、必ずしも日本政府の判断が誤りだったとはいえない。
sen.e: But it is even in this case, from the financial conditions of the Japanese government at that time (Takamori SAIGO also mentioned that financial issues was one of the reasons to against) and considering the expense to purchase carriages for the main line from Europe the United States of America and conveys them, the decision of the Japanese government was not necessarily an mistake.

But even if it were the case, if the financial conditions of the Japanese government at that time (Takamori SAIGO also mentioned financial reasons to oppose the construction) and the expenses which would have cost to purchase and convey carriages for the main line from Europe or America are considered, it cannot be said that the decision of the Japanese government was a mistake.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、かつ分かりやすくするため表現を変えました。
sen.e: But even if it were the case, if the financial conditions of the Japanese government at that time (Takamori SAIGO also mentioned financial reasons to oppose the construction) and the expenses which would have cost to purchase and convey carriages for the main line from Europe or America are considered, it cannot be said that the decision of the Japanese government was a mistake.

sen.j: いずれにしても、真相は明らかになっていない。
sen.e: In any case, the truth has not been clear.
In any case, the truth has not been brought out yet.
In any case, the truth has not been brought out yet.

sen.j: なお大隈重信は、後に狭軌を採用したことを「一生の不覚であった」と述べている。
sen.e: Furthermore, Shigenobu OKUMA has mentioned that adoption of narrow gage was "the gravest blunder in my life" afterward.
Shigenobu OKUMA remarked that the adoption of narrow gauge was "the gravest blunder in my life" afterward.
sen.cmt: Furthermoreは文の流れに合わないので削除しました。
sen.e: Shigenobu OKUMA remarked that the adoption of narrow gauge was "the gravest blunder in my life" afterward.

sen.j: 今日の日本の鉄道技術が新幹線等旅客輸送において高い水準にあるのは、狭軌へのコンプレックスが要因であるという説もある。
sen.e: Some say that a sense of inferiority for having narrow gage has made today's Japanese high-level railway technology as you may see in passenger transport, such as Shinkansen Super Express.

Some say that an inferiority complex about having narrow gauge has made today's Japanese high-level railway technology that can be seen in passenger transport systems such as Shinkansen Super Express.
